newsitem.title: FRANCE: Kuwait to up ex-Paris air cargo rates.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait to up ex-Paris air cargo rates.

text.p: Kuwait Airways said it was set to increase its ex-Paris cargo rates, to selected destinations, effective July 15.

"While we still awaiting official confirmation from headquarters in Kuwait City, it's likely we'll raise rates to the Middle East by around five percent and by eight percent to the Far East," a Paris-based cargo official for the airline told Reuters.
Rates to Kuwait City and India would probably be unchanged, the official said.
The Kuwaiti carrier last increased its ex-Paris rates in July 1996.
Kuwait Airways operates a three-times weekly passenger service between Paris and Kuwait City using Airbus 300 and 310s which can carry nine to 12 tonnes of freight per flight.

The airline also runs a weekly Boeing 707F service on a Frankfurt-Paris-Kuwait City routing and has a block booking of up to 30 tonnes on a weekly Air France 747-200F service from CDG to Kuwait City, the official added. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017 - www.racs.com
